description:
In Honduras, a nation-wide curfew was imposed on March 16. It took effect on March 16, 10 PM. Citizens can only leave their homes to go to supermarkets, pharmacies, hospitals, gas stations, and essential places of work. These exceptions DO NOT hold for the cities of La Ceiba, Choluteca, and the Central District. In these three cities, the curfew knows no exceptions and is absolute.

In these three cities, there was an exception made on March 18 from 3 PM to 10 PM for gas stations and on March 19 from 7AM to 4 PM for grocery stores (supermarkets, bakeries etc.), banks and pharmacies,

On March 19, it was announced that the absolute curfew with no exceptions would be extended to the following cities from March 20 on: Puerto Cortés, Santa Cruz de Yojoa and El Triunfo (Choluteca department). Before, the absolute curfew was already expanded to San Pedro Sula. In Puerto Cortés an exception is made for people working in the port.

On March 20, the Honduran government announced a nation-wide absolute curfew beginning the same day at 6 PM. The curfew was to remain in place until March 29, 3 PM.

Exceptions to the absolute curfew are the opening of small grocery shops and markets to serve their local communities, home delivery services of supermarkets, phamarcies, grocery shops, and bakeries, the agricultural sector, media and communications.
